classitems.description:
缓动函数, 动画效果为按时间缓动
这个函数只考虑递增, 你如果需要递减的话, 在回调里用 _maxVal - _stepval
classitems.name: easyEffect

params.name: _cb
params.description: 缓动运动时的回调

params.name: _maxVal
params.description: 缓动的最大值, default = 200

params.name: _startVal
params.description: 缓动的起始值, default = 0

params.name: _duration
params.description: 缓动的总时间, 单位毫秒, default = 200

params.name: _stepMs
params.description: 缓动的间隔, 单位毫秒, default = 2

自动识别的组件不用显式调用 jcAutoInitComps 去识别可识别的组件

JC.AutoSelect, JC.AutoChecked, JC.AjaxUpload, JC.Calendar , JC.Drag, JC.DCalendar, JC.Placeholder, JC.TableFreeze, JC.ImageCutter
Bizs.DisableLogic, Bizs.FormLogic, Bizs.MoneyTips, Bizs.AutoSelectComplete

排期日期展示

URL 占位符识别功能
require: addUrlParams, filterXSS
classitems.name: urlDetect

params.name: _url
params.description: 如果 起始字符为 URL, 那么 URL 将祝为本页的URL

example:
urlDetect( '?test' ); //output: ?test

     urlDetect( 'URL,a=1&b=2' ); //output: your.com?a=1&b=2
     urlDetect( 'URL,a=1,b=2' ); //output: your.com?a=1&b=2
     urlDetect( 'URLa=1&b=2' ); //output: your.com?a=1&b=2

classitems.description: 日期占位符识别功能
classitems.name: dateDetect

params.name: _dateStr
params.description:
如果起始字符为 NOW, 那么将视为当前日期
                                 , 如果起始字符为 NOWFirst, 那么将视为当前月的1号

example:
dateDetect( 'now' ); //2014-10-02
     dateDetect( 'now,3d' ); //2013-10-05
     dateDetect( 'now,-3d' ); //2013-09-29
     dateDetect( 'now,2w' ); //2013-10-16
     dateDetect( 'now,-2m' ); //2013-08-02
     dateDetect( 'now,4y' ); //2017-10-02

     dateDetect( 'now,1d,1w,1m,1y' ); //2014-11-10

classitems.name: init

classitems.description: 初始化可识别的 Histogram 实例
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: This funtion is assigned to the <canvas> elements as element.getContext().

Binds a function to an object. The returned function will always use the
passed in {@code obj} as {@code this}.

Example:

  g = bind(f, obj, a, b)
  g(c, d) // will do f.call(obj, a, b, c, d)

params.name: f
params.description: The function to bind the object to

params.name: obj
params.description:
The object that should act as this when the function
    is called

params.name: var_args
params.description:
Rest arguments that will be used as the initial
    arguments when the function is called

return.description: A new function that has bound this

classitems.description:
Public initializes a canvas element so that it can be used as canvas
element from now on. This is called automatically before the page is
loaded but if you are creating elements using createElement you need to
make sure this is called on the element.

params.name: el
params.description: The canvas element to initialize.

classitems.description:
This class implements CanvasRenderingContext2D interface as described by
the WHATWG.

params.name: canvasElement
params.description:
The element that the 2D context should
be associated with

classitems.description:
The text drawing function.
The maxWidth argument isn't taken in account, since no browser supports
it yet.

see: http://github.com/jrburke/requirejs for details

classitems.description:
Helper function for iterating over an array. If the func returns
a true value, it will break out of the loop.

Helper function for iterating over an array backwards. If the func
returns a true value, it will break out of the loop.

Cycles over properties in an object and calls a function for each
property value. If the function returns a truthy value, then the
iteration is stopped.

Simple function to mix in properties from source into target,
but only if target does not already have a property of the same name.
Constructs an error with a pointer to an URL with more information.

params.name: id
params.description: the error ID that maps to an ID on a web page.

params.name: message
params.description: human readable error.

params.name: err
params.description: the original error, if there is one.

classitems.description:
Trims the . and .. from an array of path segments.
It will keep a leading path segment if a .. will become
the first path segment, to help with module name lookups,
which act like paths, but can be remapped. But the end result,
all paths that use this function should look normalized.
NOTE: this method MODIFIES the input array.

params.name: ary
params.description: the array of path segments.

classitems.description:
Given a relative module name, like ./something, normalize it to
a real name that can be mapped to a path.

params.name: name
params.description: the relative name

params.name: baseName
params.description:
a real name that the name arg is relative
to.

params.name: applyMap
params.description:
apply the map config to the value. Should
only be done if this normalization is for a dependency ID.

classitems.description:
Creates a module mapping that includes plugin prefix, module
name, and path. If parentModuleMap is provided it will
also normalize the name via require.normalize()

params.name: name
params.description: the module name

params.name: parentModuleMap
params.description:
parent module map
for the module name, used to resolve relative names.

params.name: isNormalized:
params.description:
is the ID already normalized.
This is true if this call is done for a define() module ID.

params.name: applyMap:
params.description:
apply the map config to the ID.
Should only be true if this map is for a dependency.

classitems.description:
Internal method to transfer globalQueue items to this context's
defQueue.

Checks if the module is ready to define itself, and if so,
define it.

Given an event from a script node, get the requirejs info from it,
and then removes the event listeners on the node.
Set a configuration for the context.

params.name: cfg
params.description: config object to integrate.

classitems.description:
Converts a module name + .extension into an URL path.
*Requires* the use of a module name. It does not support using
plain URLs like nameToUrl.

Called to enable a module if it is still in the registry
awaiting enablement. A second arg, parent, the parent module,
is passed in for context, when this method is overriden by
the optimizer. Not shown here to keep code compact.

Internal method used by environment adapters to complete a load event.
A load event could be a script load or just a load pass from a synchronous
load call.

params.name: moduleName
params.description: the name of the module to potentially complete.

classitems.description:
Converts a module name to a file path. Supports cases where
moduleName may actually be just an URL.
Note that it **does not** call normalize on the moduleName,
it is assumed to have already been normalized. This is an
internal API, not a public one. Use toUrl for the public API.

Executes a module callback function. Broken out as a separate function
solely to allow the build system to sequence the files in the built
layer in the right sequence.
callback for script loads, used to check status of loading.

params.name: evt
params.description:
the event from the browser for the script
that was loaded.

classitems.description: Callback for script errors.

Main entry point.

If the only argument to require is a string, then the module that
is represented by that string is fetched for the appropriate context.

If the first argument is an array, then it will be treated as an array
of dependency string names to fetch. An optional function callback can
be specified to execute when all of those dependencies are available.

Make a local req variable to help Caja compliance (it assumes things
on a require that are not standardized), and to give a short
name for minification/local scope use.

Support require.config() to make it easier to cooperate with other
AMD loaders on globally agreed names.

Execute something after the current tick
of the event loop. Override for other envs
that have a better solution than setTimeout.

params.name: fn
params.description: function to execute later.

classitems.description: Export require as a global, but only if it does not already exist.

Any errors that require explicitly generates will be passed to this
function. Intercept/override it if you want custom error handling.

params.name: err
params.description: the error object.

classitems.description: Creates the node for the load command. Only used in browser envs.

Does the request to load a module for the browser case.
Make this a separate function to allow other environments
to override it.

params.name: context
params.description: the require context to find state.

params.name: moduleName
params.description: the name of the module.

params.name: url
params.description: the URL to the module.

classitems.description:
The function that handles definitions of modules. Differs from
require() in that a string for the module should be the first argument,
and the function to execute after dependencies are loaded should
return a value to define the module corresponding to the first argument's
name.

Executes the text. Normally just uses eval, but can be modified
to use a better, environment-specific call. Only used for transpiling
loader plugins, not for plain JS modules.

params.name: text
params.description: the text to execute/evaluate.

Missing item type
This funtion is assigned to the <canvas> elements as element.getContext().

Missing item type
Binds a function to an object. The returned function will always use the
passed in {@code obj} as {@code this}.

Example:

  g = bind(f, obj, a, b)
  g(c, d) // will do f.call(obj, a, b, c, d)

Missing item type
Public initializes a canvas element so that it can be used as canvas
element from now on. This is called automatically before the page is
loaded but if you are creating elements using createElement you need to
make sure this is called on the element.

the WHATWG.
